ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: well run course. Guest lectures were a nice addition
we would appreciate if the instructor provided us with feedback about the four required papers during the semester.

I really enjoyed this course. I was thankful to take it and learn more about the art and science behind industrial hygiene. As someone interested in going into medicine, while retaining a public health perspective, I saw how much of the information is translational, in that I could easily apply lessons learned in the course to practice in a medical setting. I think it's useful to learn about other content areas, and I would recommend this course.
The material is probably important to know but boy can it be dry!!!!
Very informative, full of new things to learn

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Howard J. Cohen  Howard was very knowledgeable. He was very organized and had very thorough slide presentations.
Instructor: Howard J. Cohen  Great instructor

Instructor: Howard J. Cohen  I really appreciated Dr. Cohen. I found him helpful, available on short notice, and willing to offer feedback. I also enjoyed his style of teaching, although, some of the lessons could be a little more linearly organized. In terms of his expectations for the course, I also appreciated his approach to assignments. I found I learned even more by going and having to do some additional research on topics, and that it reinforced what we were learning in class. I can also tell he has made high quality professional relationships, in that we had some interesting speakers, as well.
Instructor: Howard J. Cohen  Funny guy, very up to date on the material, lots of experience, understanding towards students
Instructor: Howard J. Cohen  Extremely friendly, has a great sense of hunour, very understanding, always makes sure we are comfortable with the work load, teaches well, great guest lectures

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: very good course. guests from industry were a perk

Good opportunity to learn about the process of protecting the health and well-being of the working population. Dr. Cohen does a nice job of synthesizing the technical and relational aspects of industrial hygiene - that it's about the employees and employers, and that there's room to expand our knowledge about this particular population.
Can be boring but an easy class that teaches you about industrial hygiene
lots of information and new things to learn that are applicable at work place and home
